CommonTerms.Term:
Each model has different sources that the modeler has determined to be statistically significant. Choose a source from the list to present data only from that source. This model contains these sources:
All Not really a separate source, it just tallies all the sources together. Reported in kg. Upper Miss TN load Combined total nitrogen loads from USGS NASQAN sites, Mississippi River at Thebes, Ill, and Ohio River at Dam 53 near Grand Chain, Ill. This combined load was a boundary condition in the MRB5 TN model representing loads from the Upper Mississippi River basin in order for the MRB5 model to account for all mass entering the study area. Atmospheric deposition Nitrogen from atmospheric deposition came from 28 active USGS NADP/NTN wet deposition sites located in the MRB5 study area. The total inorganic nitrogen wet deposition data were detrended for 2002. Point Sources Total nitrogen loads for 2002 from point sources came from USEPA PCS database. Relevant municipal and industrial point sources were included. Urban Runoff Nitrogen from nonpoint source urban runoff was estimated based on land use categories from the 2001 NLCD. The four cateogries included were nlcd_dvlow, nlcd_dvmed, nlcd_dvhig, and nlcd_dvopn. Manure - feedlots Nitrogen from manure from confined animal operations applied to fertilizer were based on 2002 USDA NASS ag census data. Manure - pasture Nitrogen from manure from pastures (unconfined) were based on 2002 USDA NASS ag census data. Fertilizer Nitrogen from fertilizer were based on county fertilizer sales from the 2002 USDA NASS ag census data.
